Uig Harbour update

Due to the revised planned closure of Uig Harbour, CalMac are pleased to confirm that bookings on Skye Triangle routes for the period 10 – 23 October will now open on 7 September. Customers that were displaced and moved onto alternative sailings within this period are advised to contact CalMac after 7 September if you wish to amend your booking.


On board Facilities

At times, some retail areas may have limited opening times on this route and some onboard passenger areas maybe be restricted.

We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.

From Monday 9th May- the passenger waiting shelter at Uig Pierhead is to be demolished and will not be available for foot passengers boarding via gangway.

The following arrangements have been made and will be in place till services cease in October.

All outbound foot passengers will be asked to wait in the main Terminal and a shuttle bus will take them down to gangway on arrival of ferry.

Inbound Passengers will be advised to board the bus for transiting the pier to the main Terminal.

Arrangements for foot Passengers with accessibility problems will remain the same, with shuttle bus boarding via Linkspan allowing access to/from the upper decks via the lift.

Tarbert & Lochmaddy will advise all foot passengers boarding of procedure and vessel will broadcast a tannoy announcement prior to arrival in Uig.

Any changes to the above will be advised as works progress.

Customer Update Uig Harbour Closure

Bookings on this service for the period 10 October 2022 - 23 October 2022 are currently unavailable. This is due to Highland Council's planned closure of Uig Harbour for essential upgrades from 10 October 2022 - 27 March 2023. We have temporarily suspended bookings for the two weeks of our summer timetable which have been affected, 10 October 2022 - 23 October 2022 until alternative ferry services options for Skye Triangle routes have been finalised. If you have already made a booking with us for this period - please be assured we still have your booking and one of our team will be in touch with you to assist with alternative arrangements. Read more.

Our onboard food, drink and retail offerings are now open. Read our food and drink FAQ for more information.

Road Works: A835 Trunk Road South of Aultguish

Monday 5th September to Friday 16th September 2022

BEAR Scotland, on behalf of Transport Scotland, are planning to carry out essential carriageway maintenance works on the A835 Trunk Road South of Aultguish.

The works are programmed for construction from Monday 5th September to Friday 16th September 2022 (subject to weather conditions), between 7am and 7pm each day, for a total of ten days with no works occurring on Saturday or Sunday.

To ensure the safety of both the work force and travelling members of the public, the carriageway will be subject to a 10mph convoy traffic management system. 

Outwith working hours, the traffic management will be removed however, a temporary 30mph speed limit will remain in place, as traffic will be travelling over a temporary surface.

 Access for emergency services will be maintained at all times.

Uig Harbour update

Due to the revised planned closure of Uig Harbour, CalMac are pleased to confirm that bookings on Skye Triangle routes for the period 10 – 23 October will now open on 7 September. Customers that were displaced and moved onto alternative sailings within this period are advised to contact CalMac after 7 September if you wish to amend your booking.


On Board Facilities

At times, some retail areas may have limited opening times on this route and some onboard passenger areas maybe be restricted.

We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.

From Monday 9th May- the passenger waiting shelter at Uig Pierhead is to be demolished and will not be available for foot passengers boarding via gangway.

The following arrangements have been made and will be in place till services cease in October.

All outbound foot passengers will be asked to wait in the main Terminal and a shuttle bus will take them down to gangway on arrival of ferry.

Inbound Passengers will be advised to board the bus for transiting the pier to the main Terminal.

Arrangements for foot Passengers with accessibility problems will remain the same, with shuttle bus boarding via Linkspan allowing access to/from the upper decks via the lift.

Tarbert & Lochmaddy will advise all foot passengers boarding of procedure and vessel will broadcast a tannoy announcement prior to arrival in Uig.

Any changes to the above will be advised as works progress.

Customer Update Uig Harbour Closure

Bookings on this service for the period 10 October 2022 - 23 October 2022 are currently unavailable. This is due to Highland Council's planned closure of Uig Harbour for essential upgrades from 10 October 2022 - 27 March 2023. We have temporarily suspended bookings for the two weeks of our summer timetable which have been affected, 10 October 2022 - 23 October 2022 until alternative ferry services options for Skye Triangle routes have been finalised. If you have already made a booking with us for this period - please be assured we still have your booking and one of our team will be in touch with you to assist with alternative arrangements. Read more.

Lochmaddy Car park

Due to pier works there is very limited carparking at Lochmaddy Terminal until March 2023. Where possible, we are advising customer’s not to park.
